    • Method Detail

      • getEckhardtMoonLibrations

        public static double[] getEckhardtMoonLibrations(TimeElement time,
                                 ObserverElement obs,
                                 EphemerisElement eph)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the orientation of the Moon according to Eckhardt's analytical theory. The results in current dates are about 0.1 deg from those obtained using IAU recommendations, and it seems the values from Eckhardt's theory are closer to those obtained using JPL ephemerides, for a few centuries around year 2000. IAU lunar rotation model is no longer used in JPARSEC.

        An adequate ephemeris object should be provided, with the algorithm to apply to obtain the lunar position. The returning values will be referred to the geocenter or the topocentric place depending on it.

        Reference:

        Eckhardt, D.H., "Theory of the Libration of the Moon", Moon and planets 25, 3 (1981).

        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        An array with the total librations (longitude and planetocentric latitude), and the position angle of axis as the 3rd element. In radians, for mean equinox of date.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getEckhardtMoonLibrations

        public static double[] getEckhardtMoonLibrations(double jd,
                                 EphemerisElement.REDUCTION_METHOD ephemMethod,
                                 LocationElement locEquatorial)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the orientation of the Moon according to Eckhardt's analytical theory.

        The results in current dates are about 0.1 deg from those obtained using IAU recommendations, and it seems the values from Eckhardt's theory are closer to those obtained using JPL ephemerides.

        An adequate ephemeris object should be provided, with the algorithm to apply to obtain the lunar position. The returning values will be refered to the geocenter or the topocentric place depending on it.

        Reference:

        Eckhardt, D.H., "Theory of the Libration of the Moon", Moon and planets 25, 3 (1981).

        Parameters:
        jd - Julian day in TT.
        ephemMethod - Ephem method to apply, constants defined in EphemerisElement.
        locEquatorial - Equatorial apparent position of the Moon for date jd.
        Returns:
        An array with the total librations (longitude and planetocentric latitude), and the position angle of axis as the 3rd element. In radians, for mean equinox of date.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPerigee

        public static SimpleEventElement getPerigee(double jd,
                            MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of the Moon's perigee, following Meeus' Astronomical Algorithms, chapter 48. Largest error compared to ELP2000 is 30 minutes. Time is corrected for Moon secular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations (TDB).
        eventType - Next, closest, or previous events, as defined in this constants of MainEvents class. The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. In the details field the value of the equatorial horizontal parallax in radians is provided. The distance in km can be calculated as d = 6378.14 / Math.sin(parallax).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getApogee

        public static SimpleEventElement getApogee(double jd,
                           MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of the next Moon's apogee, following Meeus' Astronomical Algorithms, chapter 48. Largest error compared to ELP2000 is only 3 minutes. Time is corrected for Moon secular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations (TDB).
        eventType - Next, closest, or previous events, as defined in this constants of MainEvents class. The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. In the details field the value of the equatorial horizontal parallax in radians is provided. The distance in km can be calculated as d = 6378.14 / Math.sin(parallax).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getMeanLongitudeOfAscendingNode

        public static double getMeanLongitudeOfAscendingNode(TimeElement time,
                                     ObserverElement obs,
                                     EphemerisElement eph)
                                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the mean longitude of the ascending node of the Moon following Chapront et al. 1988 (see Meeus, chapter 45).
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        Time as a Julian day.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        Returns the mean longitude of the perigee of the lunar orbit following Chapront et al. 1988 (see Meeus, chapter 45).
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.
        Returns:
        Time as a Julian day.
        Throws:

      • getPassThroughDescendingNode

        public static SimpleEventElement getPassThroughDescendingNode(double jd,
                                              MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                       throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of the a pass of the Moon through its descending node, following Meeus. Accuracy is usually better than 1 minute, and always better than 3. Time is corrected for Moon secular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations (TDB).
        eventType - Next, closest, or previous events, as defined in this constants of MainEvents class. The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPassThroughAscendingNode

        public static SimpleEventElement getPassThroughAscendingNode(double jd,
                                             MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                      throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of the a pass of the Moon through its ascending node, following Meeus. Accuracy is usually better than 1 minute, and always better than 3. Time is corrected for Moon secular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations (TDB).
        eventType - Next, closest, or previous events, as defined in this constants of MainEvents class. The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • MoonMaximumDeclination

        public static SimpleEventElement MoonMaximumDeclination(double jd,
                                        MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                 throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of a given lunar maximum geocentric declination, following Meeus's Astronomical Algorithms. Error is a few minutes at J2000, and could reach half an hour 3000 years after or before J2000 epoch. Time is corrected by Moon secular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. The details field will contains the value of the declination in degrees.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • MoonMinimumDeclination

        public static SimpleEventElement MoonMinimumDeclination(double jd,
                                        MainEvents.EVENT_TIME eventType)
                                                 throws JPARSECException
        Calculates the instant of a given lunar minimum geocentric declination, following Meeus's Astronomical Algorithms. Error is a few minutes at J2000, and could reach half an hour 3000 years after or before J2000 epoch. Time is corrected by Moon secular acceleration.
        Parameters:
        jd - The starting Julian day of calculations.
        eventType - The event type (next, last, or closest to input date). The use of the closest option is recommended when possible, since next/previous events could give incorrect events for a given date far from J2000.
        Returns:
        The event. The details field will contains the value of the declination in degrees.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getJPLMoonLibrations

        public static double[] getJPLMoonLibrations(TimeElement time,
                            ObserverElement obs,
                            EphemerisElement eph)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the lunar libration angles for JPL or Moshier ephemerides. The conversion from Mean Earth system to Principal Axis system is performed using Williams et al. 2008 formulae if ephemerides algorithm is DE422, and Seidelmann et al. 2007 (Konopliv et al. 2001) for the rest of DE4xx and Moshier's method. Results are very close to Eckhardt's theory, and better than those reported by IAU approximations for the lunar north pole or rotation.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer.
        eph - Ephemerides properties. They are forced to be apparent and for the equinox of date. Algorithm must be Moshier or JPL DE403/405/413/414/422methods.
        Returns:
        An array with total libration (physical + optical) in longitude and latitude, and axis position angle. Units are radians, referred to mean equinox of date.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getJPLMoonLibrations

        public static double[] getJPLMoonLibrations(TimeElement time,
                            ObserverElement obs,
                            EphemerisElement eph,
                            LocationElement locEquatorial)
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns the lunar libration angles for JPL or Moshier ephemerides. The conversion from Mean Earth system to Principal Axis system is performed using Williams et al. 2008 formulae if ephemerides algorithm is DE422, and Seidelmann et al. 2007 (Konopliv et al. 2001) for the rest of DE4xx and Moshier's method. Results are very close to Eckhardt's theory, and better than those reported by IAU approximations for the lunar north pole or rotation.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer.
        eph - Ephemerides properties. They are forced to be apparent and for the equinox of date. Algorithm must be Moshier or JPL DE403/405/413/414/422 methods.
        locEquatorial - Equatorial apparent position of the Moon for date jd.
        Returns:
        An array with total libration (physical + optical) in longitude and latitude, and axis position angle. Units are radians, referred to mean equinox of date.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
